description: From Middle English prohibiten, from Latin prohibeō (“I fend off, prevent, prohibit”) (through past participle prohibitus).

verbs.description: prohibit (third-person singular simple present prohibits, present participle prohibiting, simple past and past participle prohibited)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To forbid, disallow, or proscribe officially; to make illegal or illicit.
examples: The restaurant prohibits smoking on the patio.
